meanings.definition: Relating to the study of algae.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted an algological experiment to understand algae better.
meanings.sent2: Her algological research focused on the growth patterns of different types of algae.
meanings.sent3: The algological investigation into the pond's green color revealed a thriving algae population.
meanings.sent4: His algological expertise allowed him to identify the algae species just by looking at them.
meanings.sent5: The algological field trip to the coast provided hands-on experience with various algae species.

meanings.definition: Involving or pertaining to the scientific study of algae.
meanings.sent1: The textbook provided detailed information on algological research methods.
meanings.sent2: The students' algological project involved collecting samples from different aquatic environments.
meanings.sent3: During the algological conference, experts shared new findings on algae reproduction.
meanings.sent4: Her algological thesis explored the impact of pollution on algae ecosystems.
meanings.sent5: The algological lab equipment allowed precise measurements of algae cell structures.
